intro: Tithymalus szovitsii, commonly known as the Szovits' tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, thriving in cool and moist environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it blooms during the late spring to early summer season. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
